bibl.title: Despatch from Alexander G. Clark to William F. Wharton, April 9, 1891
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: 3. Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, Liberia Arpil 9th 1891
Mr Alexander Clark to the Department of State
Consulate General of the United States Monrovia Liberia April 9th 1891
Honorable William F. Wharton Assistant Secretary of State Washington D. C.

Sir: I have the honor to acknowledge receipt of your No 3 of February 13 with enclosures of Messer Yatas Brother Shattered and Company letter to the Hon Secretary of State in reference to the deposition of Captain Frank Nelson, taken by the Consular Agent at Cape Coast Castle, and beg most respectfully to say in reply that I have instructed Consul Agent Eminsang to forward same immediately, and as soon as it is received will be transmitted to you.
I have the honor to be, Sir, your obedient Servant
Alexander Clark U.S. Minister & Consul Gen
